main event: In Waterville, Maine on October 12th, 1953, a civilian reported a luminous colored object approximately 15 degrees in size moving at a high speed for 5 minutes in a slightly hazy atmosphere with scattered thin clouds.
interesting points: The observed object appeared to be a large, bright, fluorescent, oval-shaped light about the size of a full moon, and it hovered for about three minutes before disappearing in the northeast.
There was no reflection or glow in the sky before the object appeared, and there was a slight haziness around the object like a halo of pale smoke.
The citizens who witnessed the event appeared sincere and believed that what they saw warranted a report.
Supplemental photographic analyses have been completed by Project Blue Book photo analysts at Wright-Patterson AFB, and the speed of the aerial phenomena was estimated to be supersonic.
Reports from various official and unofficial government agencies did not indicate success in identifying the observed aerial phenomena.
sighted object: luminous colored object approximately 15 degrees in size
